Career Profile

I am a dedicated researcher and academic in the field of evolutionary anthropology, specializing in human biology, human behaviour, and ecology. I have published multiple scientific articles, assisted with teaching courses. I have also presented at renowned conferences and been invited as a guest speaker during my PhD career.

Education

PhD Candidate in Human Biology and Evolution

2020-2024
University College London, UK

During my PhD, I have been conducting research in evolutionary anthropology at University College London in UK, supported by a full scholarship. My research interests include social network analysis, demographic analysis, and related fields. During this time, I have published four papers in SCI journals as the lead author.

Master's Degree in Ecology

2017-2020
Lanzhou University, CHINA

During my masterâ€™s degree in ecology at Lanzhou University, which I entered through a recommendation-based admission,I worked under the supervision of Professor Ruth Mace (Fellow of the British Academy). My research focused on the evolution of human cooperative behaviour using statistical modelling. I published one SCI article as the first author and awarded a National Graduate Scholarship.

Bachelor's Degree in Biotechnology

2013-2017
Lanzhou University, CHINA

During my undergraduate studies at Lanzhou University, I focused on learning the fundamentals of biology and gaining experimental skills from both microscopic and laboratory perspectives.

Experiences

Teaching Assistant in Anthropology Department

2023-2024

I am a Teaching Assistant in the Anthropology Department at UCL for the 2023-2024 academic year. In this role, I facilitate the learning process for undergraduate students by organizing tutorial activities, leading tutorial groups in both biological anthropology and human ecology, and providing feedback on coursework. This position has enhanced my ability to communicate complex concepts in a clear and accessible way, a critical skill for undergraduate teaching. Additionally, I am responsible for grading assignments for courses in biological anthropology and human behavioural ecology.

Major Academic Invitations

EHBEA Annual Conference Talk
Invited Guest Speaker - Invited to deliver a speaker series talk and conduct a workshop at LEVYNA Laboratory, Masaryk University. Explored collaborative opportunities and shared research insights.
Invited Summer Institute Participant - Selected to join the Summer Institute in Cross-Cultural Anthropological Research at Yale University, HRAF. Explored diverse anthropological perspectives.
FRESH 4th Annual Conference Talk
HBES Annual Conference Talk - Delivered a talk during the Human Behavior and Evolution Society (HBES) Annual Meeting held in Palm Springs, USA.
EHBEA Annual Conference Talk - Presented a talk at the European Human Behaviour & Evolution Association (EHBEA) Annual Conference in London, UK.
